abstract.text: Returns an image provider from a single memory buffer.

inlineContent.text: QuartzComposer API deprecated. (Define QC_SILENCE_DEPRECATION to silence these warnings)

platforms.message: QuartzComposer API deprecated. (Define QC_SILENCE_DEPRECATION to silence these warnings)
platforms.name: macOS

inlineContent.text: The pixel format of the memory buffer. This must be compatible with the color space.
The width, in bytes, of the memory buffer.
The height, in bytes, of the memory buffer.
The base address of the memory buffer, which must be multiple of 16.
The number of bytes per row of the memory buffer, which must be multiple of 16.
The release callback. Your callback must use this type definition:

code: typedef void (*QCPlugInBufferReleaseCallback)(const void* address, void* context);

inlineContent.text: If you name your callback function
, you would declare it like this:
Quartz Composer invokes your callback when the memory buffer is no longer needed. The callback can be called from any thread at any time
The context to pass to the release callback.
The color space of the memory buffer. This must be compatible with the pixel format.
A Boolean that specifies whether Quartz Composer should color match the image. Pass
if the image is a mask or gradient or should not be color matched for some other reason. Otherwise, pass
An image provider.
You must not modify the image until the release callback is invoked.

abstract.text: Allow users to browse, edit, and save images, using slideshows and Core Image filters.
Performs the processing or rendering tasks appropriate for the custom patch.
protocol defines methods that you use only from within the execution method (
Returns an image provider from a single memory buffer.
Returns an image provider from an OpenGL texture.
A profile that specifies how to interpret a color value for display.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A raw pointer for accessing untyped data.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
